intro: Argythamnia haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian argythamnia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Haiti. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Argythamnia haitiensis is often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and disturbed soils.
